SENT.plain: CASE REPORT: Pierre-Robin syndrome (PRS) is a rare congenital malformation that shows severe micrognathia and cleft soft palate
A 15-year-old boy who was admitted with occipital headache and gait disturbance was diagnosed with PRS
Radiological evaluation revealed severe herniation of the cerebellar tonsil and multiple craniovertebral osseous anomalies
We carried out foramen magnum decompression (FMD) with duroplasty
Postoperative MRI showed the cerebellar tonsil was freed from strangulation
RESULT AND CONCLUSION: This patient presented with the common finding between PRS and Chiari type I on the embryological aspect by illustrating pathophysiology of the Chiari I malformation
To our knowledge, this is the first reported case of PRS associated with Chiari malformation type I
